title: The day I got my first Pet
contentHtml: On September 14. For so long I felt like I needed something, like an companion. So I scoll on google and Found a very adorable cat named Jasmine. I decide to went to visit Jasmine, I wasn't expect to just take her home but after seeing her for the first time, I could not hold it and decide to adopt her right on the spot.
author: Hoang Cao

title: What I want to be as a career
contentHtml: At first I didn't know what I wanted to be, I see multiple Police men driving around my city and think I wanted to become one of them, I like to obey the law and I want to protect everyone around me. But I don't feel like it was meant for me, I decide to choose the career path as a game developer because I enjoy playing video games more than anything, but after two years in college learning the basics of game design, I felt like it wasn't for me. I thought I would enjoy making video games same as playing, but it was too complicated and I wasn't enjoy doing it. So now I switched to Full-Stack-Developer since I really enjoyed making websites, its fun and I can use my imagination to create websites.
author: Hoang Cao

title: My Hobby
contentHtml: I love playing Video Games, in fact I've played Video Games for most of my life now. I mostly play PC games such as League of Legends or Valorant plus Steam games. Thanks to these game that I played for most of my life, I was able to gain multiple useful skills in life such as Multitasking, Fast Learner, Fast Thinking and Quick Reflect.
author: Hoang Cao

title: Two Forms of Pre-rendering
contentHtml: Next.js has two forms of pre-rendering: Static Generation and Server-side Rendering. The difference is in when it generates the HTML for a page.
author: Next.js

title: When to Use Static Generation v.s. Server-side Rendering
contentHtml: We recommend using Static Generation (with and without data) whenever possible because your page can be built once and served by CDN, which makes it much faster than having a server render the page on every request.
author: Next.js
